commit_message:
Added documentation for npm commands

Two NPM commands are now supported in horizon's build chain. This
patch adds documentation for `npm run lint` and `npm run test`.

Change-Id: Ibd5e82b3b696fdfb75ba7648cf619b7fc5a77a5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/98/195798/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: JavaScript Tests ----------------The default configuration also performs coverage reports, which are saved to ``horizon/.coverage-karma/`` and ``openstack_dashboard/.coverage-karma/``. To run the Karma tests for Horizon and Dashboard using the `run_tests.sh` script::To run the Karma tests for Horizon and Dashboard using `npm`:: npm install # You only need to execute this once. npm test .. note:: These two methods are equivalent. The former merely executes the latter. JavaScript Code Style Checks ---------------------------- You can run the JavaScript code style checks, or linting, using eslint. ESLint is a permissively licensed, sophisticated language parser and linter that confirms both our style guidelines, and checks the code for common errors that may create unexpected behavior. To run eslint for Horizon and Dashboard using the `run_tests.sh` script:: ./run_tests.sh --karma To run eslint for Horizon and Dashboard using `npm`:: npm install # You only need to execute this once. npm run lint .. note:: These two methods are equivalent. The former merely executes the latter.
deleted_lines: JavaScript ----------To run the Karma tests for Horizon and Dashboard::The default configuration also performs coverage reports, which are saved to ``horizon/.coverage-karma/`` and ``openstack_dashboard/.coverage-karma/``.

commit_message:
Fix resolving image.id in servers.boot

Most places resolve id of input parameter as 'base.getid'
and in the beginning of _boot function it resolves image id
with such method. But in fixed place it tries to get id directly
from object. But code that uses novaclient directly(without shell)
falls in this place because it passes string with id to image parameter.

Change-Id: Ib90e4ffa3b7835f6648a62eddf7f7b87b5ab0f7e

commit_message:
Fix tox -e py34

Add a py34 test environment to tox.ini running a subset of tests which
pass on Python 3.4. With this change, the py34 check job should pass and
so it will become possible to make the job voting to avoid further
Python 3 regressions.

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: If8a8bafe0ff7e8d27baa3467f1790c3cb776457e

commit_message:
Error message for invalid node group template details page

Using an invalid node group template ID for details URL causes
a stack trace. This patch adds a proper error message and logging
for this case.

Change-Id: Ic9ba5571b91c878ba7db112911f8c1716d90590a
Partial-Bug: #1466453

commit_message:
networking-tricircle core plugin and security group

Initial implementation include option to use ML2 but it seem that it
will be better to use a core plugin (more control) over the process

commit_message:
Update version for Liberty

Update the version for Liberty, switching from date-based versioning
to pre-versioning using SemVer. See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-May/065211.html
and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067082.html
for details.

Change-Id: I6a35fa0dda798fad93b804d00a46af80f08d475c

commit_message:
Added ironic-webclient to OpenStack

At the request of the Ironic PTL. Client makes use of
javascript-jobs, but does not yet have a deployment/packaging
mechanism.

Change-Id: Ic45c0607d408534b5b6aa9361ceeb4857850594b

subject: Labs: Wait for external bridge
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-28 18:22:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-guides/commit/4a49e566c541674402fbc78fff7485e0520ec0d8', 'message': 'Wait for external bridge

If we change configuration files right after installing service
packages, automatically started services may pick up changed
configuration files rather than the default files they were packaged
with.

If the neutron-l3-agent starts with our custom configuration file which
refers to the external bridge br-ex while that bridge is not there
(yet), the port is permanently marked as unavailable (vlan tag=4095).

In such a case, a line like this can be found in /etc/openvswitch/conf.db:
{"_date":1435514607570,"Port":{"20b0e96c-6103-46e6-a234-a4d5439eece7":{"tag":4095}},"_comment":"ovs-vsctl: /usr/bin/ovs-vsctl --timeout=10 set Port qr-4be1ab91-60 tag=4095","Open_vSwitch":{"e00f3d6f-e55a-419a-a605-141021026dee":{"next_cfg":15}}}

This is another race -- waiting for a few seconds before changing the
configuration files fixes the problem. The alternative used in this
patch is to stop the neutron-l3-agent before editing the configuration
files and to start it only once the bridge is ready.

Change-Id: I55762d17817e5e1cdb4c0420374c9fbc314bdff1

commit_message:
Labs: Wait for external bridge

If we change configuration files right after installing service
packages, automatically started services may pick up changed
configuration files rather than the default files they were packaged
with.

If the neutron-l3-agent starts with our custom configuration file which
refers to the external bridge br-ex while that bridge is not there
(yet), the port is permanently marked as unavailable (vlan tag=4095).

In such a case, a line like this can be found in /etc/openvswitch/conf.db:
{"_date":1435514607570,
"Port":{"20b0e96c-6103-46e6-a234-a4d5439eece7":{"tag":4095}}, "_comment":"
ovs-vsctl: /usr/bin/ovs-vsctl --timeout=10 set Port qr-4be1ab91-60 tag=4095"
,"Open_vSwitch":{"e00f3d6f-e55a-419a-a605-141021026dee":{"next_cfg":15}}}

For additional information, check this neutron bug:
Neutron openvswitch-agent doesn't recover ports from binding_failed status
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1399249

This is another race -- waiting for a few seconds before changing the
configuration files fixes the problem. The alternative used in this
patch is to stop the neutron-l3-agent before editing the configuration
files and to start it only once the bridge is ready.

Change-Id: I55762d17817e5e1cdb4c0420374c9fbc314bdff1
Co-Authored-By: Vigneshvar.A.S <vigneshvar.a.s@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: sayalilunkad <sayali.92720@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/66/196466/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # neutron-l3-agent has just been installed and is about to start. We are also # about to change its configuration file which tends to result in the agent # starting up with our changed configuration before the external bridge is # ready which ends with a misconfigured system (port with tag=4095). We can # either wait here for neutron-l3-agent to start with the old configuration # files, or shut it down now and start it with the new configuration files once # configuration files _and_ the external bridge are ready. echo "Stopping neutron-l3-agent for now." #sudo service neutron-l3-agent stop echo -n "Checking VLAN tags." # Wait for "tag:" to show up until sudo ovs-vsctl show|grep tag:; do echo -n "." sleep 1 done if sudo ovs-vsctl show|grep "tag: 4095"; then # tag: 4095 indicates an error echo >&2 "ERROR: port is in limbo and won't recover:" grep tag=4095 /etc/openvswitch/conf.db >&2 exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Prevent infinite 'Loading' spinner when using mouse

When the link is opened in the other tab or other window (that's what
mouse wheel or mouse left button + Ctrl/Shift modkeys do), the
'Loading' spinner will stay forever, so it should not appear in that
case.

Change-Id: I877af817f3d4de460477d19f9cef57502a1d99b9
Closes-Bug: #1405638
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/143991/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Error message for invalid cluster template details page

Using an invalid cluster template ID for cluster template
details URL causes a stack trace. This patch adds a proper
error message and logging for this case.

Change-Id: Ie2da9a7698d44947adf58693da6bbcb7bec411a8
Partial-Bug: #1466453
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/16/196616/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from horizon.utils import memoized from horizon.utils.urlresolvers import reverse # noqa @memoized.memoized_method def get_object(self): ct_id = self.kwargs["template_id"] try: return saharaclient.cluster_template_get(self.request, ct_id) except Exception: msg = _('Unable to retrieve details for ' 'cluster template "%s".') % ct_id redirect = reverse("horizon:project:data_processing." "cluster_templates:cluster-templates") exceptions.handle(self.request, msg, redirect=redirect) def get_context_data(self, **kwargs): context = super(ClusterTemplateDetailsView, self).\ get_context_data(**kwargs) context['template'] = self.get_object() return context

commit_message:
Use URLField instead of CharField for image_url

The image location for 'create image' is an external url to load the
image from, so it's more suitable to use URLField instead of CharField.

Change-Id: Ib32dbd47289537ec64972df32b46754ffe199a0a
Closes-bug: #1467787
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/27/194527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image_url = forms.URLField(label=_("Image Location"), help_text=_("An external (HTTP) URL to load " "the image from."), widget=forms.TextInput(attrs={ 'class': 'switched', 'data-switch-on': 'source', 'data-source-url': _('Image Location'), 'ng-model': 'copyFrom', 'ng-change': 'selectImageFormat(copyFrom)'}), required=False)
deleted_lines: image_url = forms.CharField(max_length=255, label=_("Image Location"), help_text=_("An external (HTTP) URL to load " "the image from."), widget=forms.TextInput(attrs={ 'class': 'switched', 'data-switch-on': 'source', 'data-source-url': _('Image Location'), 'ng-model': 'copyFrom', 'ng-change': 'selectImageFormat(copyFrom)'}), required=False)

commit_message:
IBP: fix custom partition separator

Wrong logic was applied when choosing partition separator.
It should expect cciss/nvme/loop in the middle of partition name.

Change-Id: Ib6b32dc77ecfde77afd64fd75a8672c521b49a01
Closes-Bug: #1469263

commit_message:
Add new apis for vms deployment

* added new vm object in db and handler
  to create them
* added create_vms tasks serializers
* added new handler to make partial deployment
  and spawn vms
* added tests

Implements: blueprint reduced-footprint
Change-Id: Ic2a0c1853dc057b99bed65d3e8443d3cf4202bff

added_lines: # Enable VNC related features (boolean value) vnc_enabled=<%= node['openstack']['compute']['vnc']['enabled'] %> # Sync virtual and real mouse cursors in Windows VMs (boolean value) use_usb_tablet=<%= node["openstack"]["compute"]["config"]["use_usb_tablet"] %><% if node["openstack"]["compute"]["libvirt"]["cpu_mode"] -%> cpu_mode=<%= node["openstack"]["compute"]["libvirt"]["cpu_mode"] %> <% elsif node["openstack"]["compute"]["libvirt"]["virt_type"] == "qemu" -%>

commit_message:
add 'log_handler' parameter

  * It will allow to specify 'log_handlers'
    for horizon and openstack-clients
  * Add new log handler: 'syslog'
  * Add tests for log_handler and log_level

Change-Id: Idabbc463d1bb747f495d4e07969cc9907c862ce4

commit_message:
Create MAINTAINERS.md

* Create new MAINTAINERS.md file with a pointer to central maintainers page
* Update README.md to point users at the attributes files directly
* Cleanup CONTRIBUTING.md links

Change-Id: I626074a06dc4cc8c4641c68e55f4c3ffe50658e3

commit_message:
Save disk layout information when deploying

When using 'preserve ephemeral', we save the disk layout information
so that if a rebuild is requested, we can check that the disk layout
hasn't been changed by the user.

This information (ephemeral_gb, swap_mb, and root_gb) was being
saved in the node's driver_internal_info['instance'] by
iscsi_deploy.parse_instance_info(), which may be called several
times and by e.g. validate(). However, the information should only
be saved when a node is being deployed to, and not before.

Now the information is only saved when a node is being deployed to.

This patch also includes some updates to docstrings and clean up of
code that was introduced in commit
Iecdb8db37b22c37275be3197950bbf899aa62a53.

Change-Id: If8e6a1fefe0f48e5301364143ce86e58e8740635
Closes-Bug: #1327260

commit_message:
Remove usage of sqlalchemy mutables

Don't use mutables that track states of sqlalchemy module attributes.
This seems largely unused and can lead to unexpected behavior.

Change-Id: I3aa8be1e2e6a4d34d53c2ea88fb4697f635afea4
Closes-Bug: #1464154
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/36/190536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from sqlalchemy.ext import mutableclass MutableList(mutable.Mutable, list): @classmethod def coerce(cls, key, value): if not isinstance(value, cls): if isinstance(value, list): return cls(value) return mutable.Mutable.coerce(key, value) else: return value def __delitem__(self, key): list.__delitem__(self, key) self.changed() def __setitem__(self, key, value): list.__setitem__(self, key, value) self.changed() def __getstate__(self): return list(self) def __setstate__(self, state): len = list.__len__(self) list.__delslice__(self, 0, len) list.__add__(self, state) self.changed() def append(self, value): list.append(self, value) self.changed() def remove(self, value): list.remove(self, value) self.changed() MutableList.associate_with(List) mutable.MutableDict.associate_with(LongText) mutable.MutableDict.associate_with(Json)

commit_message:
Error message for invalid job template details page

Using an invalid job template ID for details URL causes
a stack trace. This patch adds a proper error message and
logging for this case.

Change-Id: Iee3be7960292c013d0a5dc1536396c702fcdb074
Partial-Bug: #1466453

commit_message:
Add support for posting samples to notification-agent via API

This change make the ceilometer-api getting rid the pipeline. samples will
be push to notification bus when creating via /v2/meters API.

To avoid the ceilometer-api's dependency of notification-agent, especially
in some testing scenarios, this change also provide a optional parameter
that allow samples posted to storage directly.

NOTE: This change reverting the reverted patch[1] and merging it with
patch[2], the original patch[1] has caused the related bug so has been
reverted by patch[3], the patch[2] tried to fix the related bug before
the patch[1] been reverted.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/193472/

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/195866/

[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/195570/

Related-bug: #1468697
Partially implements: blueprint api-no-pipeline

Change-Id: I88cbd83910dcf79bed8a0f9616f98e4346362ab3

commit_message:
Make ServerMetadata inherit from BaseMetadata

ServerMetadata can be created with a Server instance or an ID, and its
metadata supports get, create, update, and delete operations.

This change removes the need to have the additional ServerMeta class, as
one resource can now handle server metadata operations.

Change-Id: I1203f71ef25145eabf10f72caeeff2d0ec635c93

subject: Add a base class for compute-related metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-11 23:09:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/7b280ecb6682d0b70236226e0b9f560395f91c6e', 'message': 'Add a base class for compute-related metadata

We currently have ServerMeta and ServerMetadata classes which are sort
of hard to use. Since metadata is fundamentally only a dictionary, it
would make sense to work directly with dictionaries instead of wrapping
them in a resource.

This class acts as the base class for supporting the metadata APIs
within compute, namely server and image metadata.

commit_message:
Add a base class for compute-related metadata

We currently have ServerMeta and ServerMetadata classes which are sort
of hard to use. Since metadata is fundamentally only a dictionary, it
would make sense to work directly with dictionaries instead of wrapping
them in a resource.

This class acts as the base class for supporting the metadata APIs
within compute, namely server and image metadata.

Change-Id: Iae7288275ce7b3b92846bc29cc05860d0832a82e

commit_message:
make crontab for expirer optional

This adds an 'enable_cron' switch to ceilometer::expirer, defaults to
true, so that if we want to configure the TTL but don't want to run the
expiry job via cron we don't have to.

Closes-Bug: 1468937

Change-Id: I7fd89e58f70ae41628e769ed24f1ef5c15af51f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/72/195772/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*enable_cron*] # (optional) Whether to configure a crontab entry to run the expiry. # Defaults to true. # $enable_cron = True, if $enable_cron { cron { 'ceilometer-expirer': command => $ceilometer::params::expirer_command, environment => 'PATH=/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/sbin SHELL=/bin/sh', user => 'ceilometer', minute => $minute, hour => $hour, monthday => $monthday, month => $month, weekday => $weekday } }

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-07 16:22:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a15a141495887b8ad50acc005ceaf3a138ad545c', 'message': "Look for config files in neutron root directory first

The function 'find_config_file' in neutron.common.utils is used for
finding config files when it's not possible to locate it (in tests for
example).
It will first look in 'etc' directory of the current directory (if
exists), where this will most often have the expected behavior (since
tests are run from neutron root dir) - it will
not work when tests are ran from a different directory,
for example - after vendor decomposition, running unittests from 3rd
party plugin repository.
This aims to make this function more robust by first looking for config
files within the 'etc' directory under the neutron root directory.

commit_message:
Look for config files in neutron root directory

This patch explicitly adds neutron/etc to the list of directories to search
for neutron configuration files.
This change is required for when running tests from a different directory to
the neutron root directory.
For example, trying to run unit-tests in stackforge/vmware-nsx, which
has neutron as a requirement.

Closes-Bug: #1409455

Change-Id: I672cec64aab03dcd17e74357f925904048801e9f
Signed-off-by: Roey Chen <roeyc@vmware.com>

Remove sahara/trove from RST Install Guide

We do not plan to document sahara and trove and those are not currently
published in DocBook either. Thus, remove them.

Change-Id: Id886e2640ca044ef2978c6dcfedb8a6bbc57d676
Implements: blueprint installguide-liberty

commit_message:
WIP: Remove pipelines, execution, and mistral

Change-Id: I66cb56bc2298158486ab87ab053422a524cc206c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/48/196248/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2014 - Rackspace Hosting # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import uuid from mistralclient.api import base from oslo.config import cfg from solum.api.handlers import handler from solum.common import catalog from solum.common import clients from solum.common import context from solum.common import exception from solum.common import heat_utils from solum.common import yamlutils from solum import objects from solum.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = cfg.CONF class PipelineHandler(handler.Handler): """Fulfills a request on the pipeline resource.""" def __init__(self, context): super(PipelineHandler, self).__init__(context) self._clients = None if context is not None: self._clients = clients.OpenStackClients(context) def get(self, id): """Return an pipeline.""" return objects.registry.Pipeline.get_by_uuid(self.context, id) def _context_from_trust_id(self, trust_id): cntx = context.RequestContext(trust_id=trust_id) self._clients = clients.OpenStackClients(cntx) return self._clients.keystone().context def trigger_workflow(self, trigger_id): """Get trigger by trigger id and execute the associated workbook.""" # Note: self.context will be None at this point as this is a # non-authenticated request. db_obj = objects.registry.Pipeline.get_by_trigger_id(None, trigger_id) # get the trust context and authenticate it. try: self.context = self._context_from_trust_id(db_obj.trust_id) except exception.AuthorizationFailure as auth_ex: LOG.warn(auth_ex) return self._execute_workbook(db_obj) def _get_context_from_last_execution(self, pipeline): last_execution = pipeline.last_execution() if last_execution is None: return osc = self._clients try: execution = osc.mistral().executions.get( pipeline.workbook_name, last_execution.uuid) execution_ctx = json.loads(execution.context) str_definition = osc.mistral().workbooks.get_definition( pipeline.workbook_name) definition = yamlutils.load(str_definition) except base.APIException: LOG.debug('Could not get last_execution(%s)' % last_execution, exc_info=True) return tasks = definition['Workflow'].get('tasks', {}) inputs = set() outputs = set() for act in tasks: inputs |= set(tasks[act].get('parameters', {}).keys()) outputs |= set(tasks[act].get('publish', {}).keys()) inputs -= outputs return dict((key, execution_ctx.get(key)) for key in inputs) def _build_execution_context(self, pipeline): # try and read the context from the previous execution ctx = self._get_context_from_last_execution(pipeline) if ctx is not None: return ctx ctx = {} # service urls. kc = self._clients.keystone() ctx['heat_service_url'] = kc.client.service_catalog.url_for( service_type='orchestration', endpoint_type='publicURL') ctx['build_service_url'] = kc.client.service_catalog.url_for( service_type='image_builder', endpoint_type='publicURL') # extract context from the plan # TODO(asalkeld) this should be versioned. plan_obj = objects.registry.Plan.get_by_id(self.context, pipeline.plan_id) ctx['name'] = plan_obj.name artifacts = plan_obj.raw_content.get('artifacts', []) for arti in artifacts: ctx['source_uri'] = arti['content']['href'] ctx['base_image_id'] = arti.get('language_pack', 'auto') ctx['source_format'] = arti.get('artifact_type', 'heroku') ctx['image_format'] = arti.get('image_format', CONF.api.image_format) ctx['template'] = catalog.get('templates', 'basic') # TODO(asalkeld) add support to the plan to pass heat parameters. ctx['parameters'] = {'app_name': pipeline.name} ctx['parameters'].update( heat_utils.get_network_parameters(self._clients)) ctx['stack_id'] = self._create_empty_stack(pipeline) ctx['stack_name'] = pipeline.name # TODO(asalkeld) integrate the Environment into the context. return ctx def _create_empty_stack(self, pipeline): osc = self._clients template = catalog.get('templates', 'empty') created_stack = osc.heat().stacks.create(stack_name=pipeline.name, template=template) return created_stack['stack']['id'] def _delete_stack(self, pipeline): execution_ctx = self._get_context_from_last_execution(pipeline) if execution_ctx is not None and 'stack_id' in execution_ctx: osc = self._clients osc.heat().stacks.delete(stack_id=execution_ctx['stack_id']) def _execute_workbook(self, pipeline): execution_ctx = self._build_execution_context(pipeline) osc = self._clients resp = osc.mistral().executions.create(pipeline.workbook_name, 'start', execution_ctx) ex_obj = objects.registry.Execution() ex_obj.uuid = resp.id ex_obj.pipeline_id = pipeline.id ex_obj.create(self.context) def _ensure_workbook(self, pipeline): osc = clients.OpenStackClients(self.context) try: osc.mistral().workbooks.get(pipeline.workbook_name) except Exception as excp: if 'Workbook not found' in str(excp): definition = catalog.get('workbooks', pipeline.workbook_name) # create the workbook for the user. osc.mistral().workbooks.create( pipeline.workbook_name, 'solum generated workbook', ['solum', 'builtin']) osc.mistral().workbooks.upload_definition( pipeline.workbook_name, definition) else: raise def update(self, id, data): """Modify a resource.""" updated = objects.registry.Pipeline.update_and_save(self.context, id, data) return updated def delete(self, id): """Delete a resource.""" db_obj = objects.registry.Pipeline.get_by_uuid(self.context, id) self._delete_stack(db_obj) # delete the trust. self._clients.keystone().delete_trust(db_obj.trust_id) db_obj.destroy(self.context) def create(self, data): """Create a new resource.""" db_obj = objects.registry.Pipeline() db_obj.update(data) db_obj.uuid = str(uuid.uuid4()) db_obj.user_id = self.context.user db_obj.project_id = self.context.tenant db_obj.trigger_id = str(uuid.uuid4()) # create the trust_id and store it. trust_context = self._clients.keystone().create_trust_context() db_obj.trust_id = trust_context.trust_id db_obj.create(self.context) self._ensure_workbook(db_obj) self._execute_workbook(db_obj) return db_obj def get_all(self): """Return all pipelines, based on the query provided.""" return objects.registry.PipelineList.get_all(self.context)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-17 16:22:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/58857e77e346804945ba8983e093275443b0fd0e', 'message': "Add support for generic volume migration

This patch changes the generic volume migration logic to support
non-attachable volumes.  Previously in generic volume migration, each
volume was attached locally and dd was executed on the block device
paths to move volume contents from source to target.  This patch adds an
'is_attachable' method that volume drivers can use to express whether or
not they support local attachment.  If one or both of the volumes
involved in a migration operation cannot be attached locally, the
manager will now attempt to open a file handle for both volumes and move
data from source to target using file I/O.  This allows drivers like RBD
to participate in volume migration using file I/O when it would
otherwise be impossible as attachment is not supported.

Because an instance of both source and target volumes is necessary to
open the needed file handles, the migration logic is moved from the
volume driver into the manager.  A previous approach attempted to leave
the logic in the volume driver, but instantiating a new driver at that
layer became too messy.

Support for RBD is included as a reference for other drivers that wish
to take advantage of this alternative approach.

Using file I/O will bypass our I/O throttling code as it uses cgroups to
limit block device traffic.  A solution for this will come in a future
patch.

Related-Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Change-Id: I2d6d7601a15fff1cf9f3386c13af485c6dbce2d3

commit_message:
Add support for generic volume migration

This patch changes the generic volume migration logic to support
non-attachable volumes.  Previously in generic volume migration, each
volume was attached locally and dd was executed on the block device
paths to move volume contents from source to target.  This patch adds an
'is_attachable' method that volume drivers can use to express whether or
not they support local attachment.  If one or both of the volumes
involved in a migration operation cannot be attached locally, the
manager will now attempt to open a file handle for both volumes and move
data from source to target using file I/O.  This allows drivers like RBD
to participate in volume migration using file I/O when it would
otherwise be impossible as attachment is not supported.

Because an instance of both source and target volumes is necessary to
open the needed file handles, the migration logic is moved from the
volume driver into the manager.  A previous approach attempted to leave
the logic in the volume driver, but instantiating a new driver at that
layer became too messy.

Support for RBD is included as a reference for other drivers that wish
to take advantage of this alternative approach.

Using file I/O will bypass our I/O throttling code as it uses cgroups to
limit block device traffic.  A solution for this will come in a future
patch.

Related-Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Change-Id: I2d6d7601a15fff1cf9f3386c13af485c6dbce2d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/02/135002/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def fake_is_attachable(self, ctxt, volume): return True # Since we're testing the generic migration implementation, the # volume-specific logic should not be called. # For this test, we'll assume that both volumes are attachable (which # is the default). self.stubs.Set(volume_rpcapi.VolumeAPI, 'is_attachable', fake_is_attachable) # Since both volume are attachable, we should eventually reach this # routine that actually moves the data. If we get here, things have # gone according to plan. self.stubs.Set(self.volume, '_copy_volume_using_paths', lambda x, y, z: True) # A volume is deleted only on exception, make sure it's not called.
deleted_lines: self.stubs.Set(self.volume.driver, 'copy_volume_data', lambda x, y, z, remote='dest': True)

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.service

oslo.service has graduated, so ironic should consume it.

Change-Id: Iaa1ca0d97b92b9a6858b2c2d50eb514cc2118762
Closes-Bug: #1466851

commit_message:
Cache negotiated api microversion for server

If we negotiate an API microversion in the ironiccclient, cache
this value so that we don't need to re-negotiate it again for the
next API call, if the user doesn't specify a version.

We cache the version for a particular ironic instance in a
temporary file, one per server, in a multi-user, multi-server
safe-way - deleting old files once they expire, so only the
latest is kept.

Depends-On: Icb29fdc92ecd54e388b7c16899070572458308da
Change-Id: I0232bc611789fb96491d855020042e23ba0c4fab
Blueprint: version-caching
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/74/173674/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ironicclient.common import filecache # Cache the negotiated version for this server, if possible try: host = self.get_server() filecache.save_data(host=host, data=negotiated_ver) except AttributeError: pass def get_server(self): """Return the server to which a connection is being made.""" (_class, _args, _kwargs) = self.connection_params return _args[0] # If the user didn't specify a version, use a cached version if one # has been stored if self.api_version_select_state != 'user': saved_version = filecache.retrieve_data(host=self.get_server()) if saved_version: self.os_ironic_api_version = saved_version
deleted_lines: # TODO(deva): cache the negotiated version for this server

commit_message:
Make swift_proxy_vars not a required variable

The swift_proxy_vars settings per swift-proxy_hosts entry should not be
a required variable. This patch ensures that if it isn't specified the
plays will still run as normal.

Change-Id: I0ce8c3781c6fccb0fd757498222d1dab6124313f
Closes-Bug: #1469134

commit_message:
Alphabetize QoS specs

setup.cfg and the implementation had some functions that were
not in alphabetical order. Since the rest of OSC is alphabetized,
let's stick to that.

Change-Id: Ief5d4694c7b6bc20a0898437b96305885104d45c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/20/196520/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove legacy special-cases

This patch set removes legacy special-cases.
Because as dtroyer says, we can remove legacy special-cases after
is_XXX_enabled() are implemented, and these functions are
already implemented.

 * is_nova_enabled
 * is_cinder_enabled
 * is_ceilometer_enabled
 * is_glance_enabled
 * is_ironic_enabled
 * is_neutron_enabled
 * is_trove_enabled
 * is_swift_enabled

Change-Id: Iba5cae449fa98a8ece4ac121e90c991c0f30cf0f
Closes-Bug: #1469160
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/92/196692/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[MU4] Oslo.Messaging issue fixed

Adds possible usage of undefined variable in oslo.messaging resolved
issue.

Change-Id: Icf2926e74329aa2f5b5b7db0cb74b00678e38d6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/76/195976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Oslo.Messaging -------------- Resolved Issues +++++++++++++++ * In the ``reconnect()`` method, a variable was defined after it had been used in the ``if`` section. This could lead to an unpredictable behavior while getting timeout exception on connection. The varaiable definition in ``Connection.reconnect()`` has been fixed. See `LP1465300 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1465300>`_. * The OCF scripts update procedure by RPM/DEB packages is introduced. See `LP1465771 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1465771>`_.

commit_message:
RN6.0-updates4 Nova resolved issues

Resolved issues:
- nova-compute status down after reboot master p_rabbitmq-server;
- Suspend and snapshot doesn't work for SR-IOV.

Change-Id: Ifa6df2f756d642f7a47e99827db678ae190e6b00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/83/191083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Previously, ``_poll_connection`` could fall into a loop waiting for a reply message if RabbitMQ was down and up after a reboot. The issue is fixed. See `LP1454174`_. * API is updated to pass the context explicitly, rather than getting it from the respective surrounding code. Also, the snapshot method is updated to pass context to ``detach_sriov_ports``. See `LP1452294`_. .. _`LP1454174`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1454174 .. _`LP1452294`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1452294

commit_message:
RN6.0-updates4: Keystone resolved issues

Adds 3 fixed bugs for Keystone:

* InternalServerError: Maximum lock attempts on _lockrevocation-list
  occurred. (Disable debug mode to suppress these details.) (HTTP 500)
* sometimes haproxy gets 504 when tries to reach keystone.

Change-Id: I0b9e609233a62ee97c37bdb5e23985821293c045
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/28/191028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * CVE-2015-1852 vulnerability in OpenStack keystonemiddleware has been fixed: the s3_token middleware used to effectively ignore the value set for the ``insecure`` option in the ``paste.ini`` file assuming it is always ``True``. As a result, certificate verification was disabled, leaving TLS connections opened to MITM attacks. See `LP1442579`_. * A correct version of ``oslo.utils`` was added to the requirements package, so the python27 jobs in the OSTF tests for ``python-keystoneclient`` do not fail anymore. See `LP1459286`_. * While the token is being deleted, its revocation list update is now removed if an SQL database is used as a token revocation storage. See `LP1435912`_. * The SQL initialization now occurs after the eventlet monkeypatching to avoid the SQLAlchemy locks. See `LP1425559`_. .. Links.. _`LP1459286`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1459286 .. _`LP1435912`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1435912 .. _`LP1425559`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1425559
deleted_lines: * CVE-2015-1852 vulnerability in OpenStack keystonemiddleware has been fixed: the s3_token middleware used to effectively ignore the value set for the ``insecure`` option in the ``paste.ini`` file assuming it is always ``True``. As a result, certificate verification was disabled, leaving TLS connections opened to MITM attacks. See `LP1442579`_.

commit_message:
RN6.0-updates4 Cinder resolved issues

Resolved issues:
- Cinder RBD driver blocks service on long-running tasks;
- Format-guessing and file disclosure in image convert.

Change-Id: Id3b20e84d0ff482840846d52c9b73cfc7b7c3717
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/02/191002/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: perform DB sync there anymore. See `LP1422350`_. * Previously, making long-running tasks like removing big volumes (100GB, 1TB) blocked eventlet loop and all cinder-volume services hanged until the volumes were removed. The issue is fixed by moving all rados calls to a separate python thread that does not block eventlet loop. See `LP1444546`_. * Now, in case of restarting RabbitMQ during rpc-call ``oslo.messaging`` RPC does not get stuck doing infinite connection retries anymore. See `LP1457055`_. .. Links .. _`LP1422350`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1422350 .. _`LP1444546`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1444546 .. _`LP1457055`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1457055
deleted_lines: perform DB sync there anymore. See `LP1422350 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1422350>`_.

commit_message:
Fix broken URL to docs.openstack.org

We do not publish anymore to docs.openstack.org/trunk. Only a few
redirects exist.

 http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/admin/content/adding-images.html
redirects to
http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/chapter_cli-glance-property.html,
so let's use that URL.

Change-Id: I3069175b61d4624d95f8809601c33b4b8322a15a
Closes-Bug: #1468973

commit_message:
Add a couple of new hacking checks

* D705: timeutils.utcnow() must be used instead of datetime.%s()
* D706: Don't translate debug level logs
* D707: basestring is not Python3-compatible, use six.string_types instead.
* D708: Do not use xrange. Use range, or six.moves.range for large loops.
* D709: LOG.audit is deprecated, please use LOG.info!

Change-Id: I5c20102907dfd5534691641a8de102b22c94ed9a

deleted_lines: pattern='x-%s.org.' % i) for i in xrange(0, 10)]

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-20 14:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['designate-dashboard/locale/designate-dashboard.pot', 'manage.py', 'designatedashboard/tests/test_designatedashboard.py', 'requirements.txt', '.gitignore', 'designatedashboard/dashboards/project/dns_domains/tests.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'designatedashboard/tests/settings.py', 'setup.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate-dashboard/commit/49d44524d99b0dd87130d0389d765de2579861a9', 'message': 'Conform to Consistent Testing Interface

Make minimal changes necessary conform to, and pass,
the Consistent Testing Interface[1].

* tox -epy27
* tox -epep8
* tox -ecover
* tox -evenv python setup.py sdist
* tox -evenv python setup.py build_sphinx
* tox -evenv python setup.py extract_messages

The only exception to this is currently:

* tox -evenv python setup.py update_catalog

[1]: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I50dd7fa9bbdd6a09b25ad0ee3785d37f2a32045f
'}]
commit_message:
Conform to Consistent Testing Interface

Make minimal changes necessary conform to, and pass,
the Consistent Testing Interface[1].

* tox -epy27
* tox -epep8
* tox -ecover
* tox -evenv python setup.py sdist
* tox -evenv python setup.py build_sphinx
* tox -evenv python setup.py extract_messages

The only exception to this is currently:

* tox -evenv python setup.py update_catalog

[1]: http://governance.openstack.org/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I50dd7fa9bbdd6a09b25ad0ee3785d37f2a32045f

Patch to remove unused datastore selection methods in vmdk module.

commit_message:
Drop swift ceilometer middleware.

Per Ceilometer commit 191f7bf9ccee33d8444f7dac5c09ceccce72ca29
 (change ID: Ifd1861e3df46fad0e44ff9b5cbd58711bbc87c97) the
Swift Ceilometer middleware no longer exists so we need
to drop it in order to work with the latest upstream
package.

Change-Id: Iebaad0ba477001d663c6875b32d691bbfcda3d8d

commit_message:
Add Dell Storage Center Cinder extra spec info

The volume type extra spec storagetype:storageprofile
can now be used to allow volumes to be created with
Storage Profiles other than the default.

This patch adds documentation around what this feature
is and how to configure it using the extra specs.

This documents a new feature for Liberty.

Backport: none
Change-Id: I042a8db4b53ae7b5ab0f136ceeb6e8b09734c5e1
Depends-On: Icf76fceca5a0ae20bb08b276b0c41ef6cdb31087
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/10/194310/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <title>Extra Spec Options</title> <para>Volume type extra specs can be used to select different Storage Profiles.</para> <para>Storage Profiles control how Storage Center manages volume data. For a given volume, the selected Storage Profile dictates which disk tier accepts initial writes, as well as how data progression moves data between tiers to balance performance and cost. Predefined Storage Profiles are the most effective way to manage data in Storage Center.</para> <para>By default, if no Storage Profile is specified in the volume extra specs, the default Storage Profile for the user account configured for the Cinder driver will be used. The extra spec key <literal>storagetype:storageprofile</literal> with the value of the name of the Storage Profile on the Storage Center can be set to allow using Storage Profiles other than the default.</para> <para>For ease of use from the command line, spaces in Storage Profile names will be ignored. As an example, here is how to define two volume types using the <literal>High Priority</literal> and <literal>Low Priority</literal> Storage Profiles:</para> <screen> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>cinder type-create "GoldVolumeType"</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>cinder type-key "GoldVolumeType" set storagetype:storageprofile=highpriority</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>cinder type-create "BronzeVolumeType"</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>cinder type-key "BronzeVolumeType" set storagetype:storageprofile=lowpriority</userinput> </screen> </simplesect> <simplesect>

added_lines: [testenv:pip-missing-reqs] # do not install test-requirements as that will pollute the virtualenv for # determining missing packages # this also means that pip-missing-reqs must be installed separately, outside # of the requirements.txt files deps = pip_missing_reqs -rrequirements.txt commands = pip-missing-reqs -d --ignore-module=oslo_policy* --ignore-module=pkg_resources --ignore-file=oslo_policy/test.py --ignore-file=oslo_policy/tests/* oslo_policy

commit_message:
dib-lint: make it work on Mac OS X

Pass an explicit template to mktemp since that is required on Mac OS X.
Hardcoded to /tmp since I did not want to bother validating TMPDIR which
is user supplied.

Explicit define a repeating group which causes a grep error:
    repetition-operator operand invalid

Change-Id: Ib23cc15db7f7dfdd611280884e46342562d545df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/19/193019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: from neutron import context from neutron.tests.unit import testlib_api from networking_bgpvpn.neutron.db.bgpvpn.bgpvpn_db \ import BGPVPNConnectionNotFound from networking_bgpvpn.neutron.db.bgpvpn.bgpvpn_db import BGPVPNPluginDb class BGPVPNDBTestCase(testlib_api.SqlTestCase): def setUp(self): super(BGPVPNDBTestCase, self).setUp() self.ctx = context.get_admin_context() self.plugin_db = BGPVPNPluginDb() def test_bgpvpnconnection_create_delete(self): with self.ctx.session.begin(subtransactions=True): # create bgpvpncnx = self.plugin_db.create_bgpvpn_connection( self.ctx, {"bgpvpn_connection": { "type": "l3", "name": "", "network_id": None, "route_targets": ["64512:1"], "import_targets": ["64512:11", "64512:12"], "export_targets": ["64512:13", "64512:14"], "auto_aggregate": False }} ) # retrieve bgpvpncnx = self.plugin_db.get_bgpvpn_connection(self.ctx, bgpvpncnx['id']) # check self.assertEqual("l3", bgpvpncnx['type']) # we could check tenant_id self.assertEqual(["64512:1"], bgpvpncnx['route_targets']) self.assertEqual(["64512:11", "64512:12"], bgpvpncnx['import_targets']) self.assertEqual(["64512:13", "64512:14"], bgpvpncnx['export_targets']) self.assertEqual(False, bgpvpncnx['auto_aggregate']) # update self.plugin_db.update_bgpvpn_connection( self.ctx, bgpvpncnx['id'], {"bgpvpn_connection": { "type": "l2", "name": "foo", "tenant_id": "a-b-c-d", #"network_id": "1-2-3-4", "route_targets": [], "import_targets": ["64512:22"], "auto_aggregate": True }}) # retrieve bgpvpncnx = self.plugin_db.get_bgpvpn_connection(self.ctx, bgpvpncnx['id']) # check self.assertEqual("l2", bgpvpncnx['type']) self.assertEqual("a-b-c-d", bgpvpncnx['tenant_id']) #self.assertEqual("1-2-3-4", bgpvpncnx['network_id']) self.assertEqual("foo", bgpvpncnx['name']) self.assertEqual([], bgpvpncnx['route_targets']) self.assertEqual(["64512:22"], bgpvpncnx['import_targets']) self.assertEqual(["64512:13", "64512:14"], bgpvpncnx['export_targets']) self.assertEqual(True, bgpvpncnx['auto_aggregate']) # delete self.plugin_db.delete_bgpvpn_connection(self.ctx, bgpvpncnx['id']) # check that delete was effective self.assertRaises(BGPVPNConnectionNotFound, self.plugin_db.get_bgpvpn_connection, self.ctx, bgpvpncnx['id'])

commit_message:
Adding functional test cases for Kubernetes APIs

This patch add test for below Kubernetes APIs:
1. createPod
2. readPod
3. deletePod
4. createService
5. readService
6. deleteService
7. createReplicationController
8. readReplicationController
9. deleteReplicationController

Change-Id: I3b1964645f07a172486c60b4c557fe64d29ecbe0
Closes-bug: #1460236

added_lines: from magnum.common.pythonk8sclient import client from magnum.tests import basefrom magnumclient.v1 import client as v1client cls.cs = v1client.Client(username=user, api_key=passwd, project_id=tenant_id, project_name=tenant, auth_url=auth_url, service_type='container', region_name=region_name, magnum_url=magnum_url) def _create_baymodel(cls, name): name=name, def _create_bay(cls, name, baymodel_uuid, wait=True): name=name, baymodel = self._create_baymodel('testbaymodel') self.baymodel = self._create_baymodel('testbay') bay = self._create_bay('testbay', self.baymodel.uuid) ["DELETE_FAILED", "CREATE_FAILED", class TestKubernetesAPIs(BaseMagnumClient): @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(TestKubernetesAPIs, cls).setUpClass() cls.baymodel = cls._create_baymodel('testk8sAPI') cls.bay = cls._create_bay('testk8sAPI', cls.baymodel.uuid) kube_master_ip = cls.cs.bays.get(cls.bay.uuid).api_address kube_master_url = 'http://%s:8080' % kube_master_ip k8s_client = client.swagger.ApiClient(kube_master_url) cls.k8s_api = client.ApivbetaApi.ApivbetaApi(k8s_client) @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): cls._delete_bay(cls.bay.uuid) try: cls._wait_on_status(cls.bay, ["CREATE_COMPLETE", "DELETE_IN_PROGRESS"], ["DELETE_FAILED", "CREATE_FAILED", "DELETE_COMPLETE"]) except exceptions.NotFound: pass cls._delete_baymodel(cls.baymodel.uuid) def test_pod_apis(self): pod_manifest = {'apiVersion': 'v1beta3', 'kind': 'Pod', 'metadata': {'color': 'blue', 'name': 'test'}, 'spec': {'containers': [{'image': 'dockerfile/redis', 'name': 'redis'}]}} resp = self.k8s_api.createPod(body=pod_manifest, namespaces='default') self.assertEqual(resp.metadata['name'], 'test') self.assertTrue(resp.status.phase) resp = self.k8s_api.readPod(name='test', namespaces='default') self.assertEqual(resp.metadata['name'], 'test') self.assertTrue(resp.status.phase) resp = self.k8s_api.deletePod(name='test', namespaces='default') self.assertFalse(resp.phase) def test_service_api(self): service_manifest = {u'apiVersion': u'v1beta3', u'kind': u'Service', u'metadata': {u'labels': {u'name': u'frontend'}, u'name': u'frontend', u'resourceversion': u'v1beta3'}, u'spec': {u'ports': [{u'port': 80, u'protocol': u'TCP', u'targetPort': 80}], u'selector': {u'name': u'frontend'}}} resp = self.k8s_api.createService(body=service_manifest, namespaces='default') self.assertEqual(resp.metadata['name'], 'frontend') self.assertTrue(resp.status) resp = self.k8s_api.readService(name='frontend', namespaces='default') self.assertEqual(resp.metadata['name'], 'frontend') self.assertTrue(resp.status) resp = self.k8s_api.deleteService(name='frontend', namespaces='default') # TODO(madhuri) Currently the V1beta3_ServiceStatus # has no attribute defined. commit_message:
Locking ironic API microversion

Due to changes related to the ironic state machine, and impending
breaking change that enroll node state will cause, we will lock the
ironic API microversion that shade utilizes to ensure consistent
user experience until shade receives sufficent updates to perform
the state transitions for the user.

Blueprint: enroll-node-state
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/enroll-node-state

Change-Id: I3332fdadcfe0759ef4ebe237a6d0bbdca4b10272
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/34/195634/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Identify ironic API microversion or set a default value # that is known to be supported/tested with the contents of # shade. # # Note(TheJulia): Defaulted to version 1.6 as the ironic # state machine changes which will increment the version # and break an automatic transition of an enrolled node # to an available state. Locking the version is intended # to utilize the original transition until shade supports # calling for node inspection. try: ironic_api_microversion = self.auth['os_ironic_api_version'] except KeyError: ironic_api_microversion = '1.6' timeout=self.api_timeout, os_ironic_api_version=ironic_api_microversion)

Some clouds out there are still running nova-network but we want to
provide support for neutron specific features and concepts like ports,
networks, subnets, etc.
This changeset adds neutron support to existing floating IP-related
functions, hiding that behind resource-oriented methods.
For instance, at high level, end-users can now request that a public IP
is assigned to an instance without worrying about the specific service,
procedures and protocols used to provide that feature in the target
cloud.

Change-Id: Ib53923246e095283e1b470e50aeac3050b8c296e

commit_message:
Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP tests

Nova/Neutron floating IP unit and functional tests.

Some clouds out there are still running nova-network but we want to
provide support for neutron specific features and concepts like ports,
networks, subnets, etc.

This change is part of a set that adds neutron support to existing
floating IP-related functions, hiding that behind resource-oriented
methods.
For instance, at high level, end-users can now request that a public IP
is assigned to an instance without worrying about the specific service,
procedures and protocols used to provide that feature in the target
cloud.

Change-Id: Ib53923246e095283e1b470e50aeac3050b8c296e

commit_message:
Adding SSL arguments to glance client

I am using os_server ansible module to boot VMs. This fails in a
SSL Openstack env. It fails listing the images because it is verifying
the cert.

commit_message:
Limit and Next to Open Ended Queries.

Open ended queries are usually not a good practice since it is not possible to
predict the amount of data that is returned to the client. This generates issues
like client time-out or data flood.

The proposal is to always have a limit for queries that do not significantly
restrict the scope of the response and provide a link to retrieve the other
chunk (or rest) of the available data.

Change-Id: I78a0bfbb0cc06430a7e64aff27c2a4df40f85a2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/18/128418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Limit and Next to Open Ended Queries ==================================== Open ended queries are usually not a good practice since it is not possible to predict the amount of data that is returned to the client. This generates issues like client time-out or data flood. Problem description =================== Ceilometer allows open ended queries for meters and nearly open ended for samples. In the meters case it is possible to request all the meters of all the projects. This should not be allowed a limited to a certain configurable amount. It is possible to express a optional project-id query parameter, but even in this case the data can be overwhelming. Samples already introduces a concept of limit, even if this is optional. The proposal is to always have a limit for queries that do not significantly restrict the scope of the response and provide a link to retrieve the other chunk (or rest) of the available data. Proposed change =============== Introduce a query-limit parameter in the configuration file. When a request that is either open ended or has the potential of returning a massive amount of data the query-limit is put in place and the client is served with the limited subset of data. Part of the subset is a mechanism, e.g. link to other subset or link to entire remaining collection, to retrieve the data. MongoDB and other big data engines have a similar concept built in. Alternatives ------------ Openstack has defined a pagination solution that is powerful but at the same time complex to implement. The ability of retrieving data in both directions is not that useful in Ceilometer and does complicate database queries significantly. Even if a simplified pagination mechanism was implemented in Ceilomented it does not address the need of a default/configuration setting to avoid returning all the data in the database. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- PNone. Other end user impact --------------------- End users benefits from this feature avoiding potential time out. Horizon now have the ability to efficiently paginate content requesting the first batch and subsequents (if needed) simply making other requests using the provided links as part of the response. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- Limiting the set of data returned (and potentially queried in the db), gives Ceilometer a better response time and reduces the amount of memory that the database needs to perform the query itself. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: fabgia Other contributors: nealph Ongoing maintainer: fabgia/nealph Work Items ---------- TBD. Future lifecycle ================ TBD. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= TBD. Documentation Impact ==================== New parameter in the configuration. References ========== None.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-29 11:56:08.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/e8d9f4f9911fe158ad82d1356ff82913e70af58a', 'message': 'Fix abstract `process_measures` method signature

Currently, always we call method <storage_driver>.process_measures
with one indexer instance argument, but abstract method doesn't

commit_message:
Fix abstract `process_measures` method signature

Currently, always we call method <storage_driver>.process_measures
with one indexer instance argument, but abstract method doesn't
have any arguments in signature. So, if one of our drivers
will not implement this method any calls will fail with
"process_measures() takes no arguments (1 given)".
In this CR this point have been fixed.

Change-Id: I5c77f33951f07b5a9ffe866150137d3bde1005d9

commit_message:
Controllers number increased by 1 and network creation order changed

- Normal HA configuration assumes odd number of controlles.
  Now their quantity is 3.

- Network creation should be done prior OSTF test but right after
  second deploy with removed&added controller

Change-Id: I6d2d3a6dccd74065263a02c2ebba263eeaa8c7ed
Closes-Bug: 1468302

commit_message:
Harden scheduler.rpcapi unit tests

Tests for scheduler.rpcapi are very weak. Even changing keyword
arguments names passed to call and cast methods in this module
doesn't trigger unit tests failures. This commit adds keyword
arguments validation to prevent problems similar to ones caused
by bug 1467841 in backup.rpcapi. I've also fixed argument order
in assertEqual usages there.

Change-Id: I78d80d5c5596fb5615608f93157d4d2b3a9b0aef
Related-Bug: 1467841

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Also set the OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION override variable so
that oslo.db opportunistic detection will know to use PyMySQL until
I12b32dc097a121bd43991bc38dd4d289b65e86c1 makes it the default
behavior.

Change-Id: I66b7d6053643e82d9c11af568190d82ffe7f385e
Co-Authored-By: Victor Sergeyev <vsergeyev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add iscsi_target_flags configuration option

Newly introduced `iscsi_target_flags' allows to specify `tgtd'
backing storage flags. This can be used to instruct `tgtd' to
open backing device file using `O_DIRECT' flag ensuring direct
access without cache.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1441935
Change-Id: I9c7c88a7ae75096042104849c1b00aa47728e0d4

commit_message:
service: Support for running periodic tasks in a separate thread

This blueprint enables developers to request running designated periodic tasks
on a thread group in a separate thread.

Change-Id: I41a284ad91ba1212eb8245fd4be8173080ad740c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/03/134303/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================================= Support for running periodic tasks in a separate thread ======================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/parallel-periodic-task This blueprint enables developers to request running designated periodic tasks on a thread group in a separate thread. Problem description =================== Ironic is extensively using periodic tasks to be up-to-date with the hardware. The most troublesome place is syncing power states: it requires talking to BMC and buggy BMC may take a lot of time to respond. Also with scale even quick BMC become a problem. While we can't fix it for now, we would prefer to at least isolate this periodic task from the others. PeriodicTasks needs a way to run selected tasks in separate threads. Proposed change =============== This proposal is based on a proof-of-concept implementation in Ironic tree: [1]. Changes are proposed to the yet-to-be-created oslo.service project. * Add ``parallel`` argument (boolean, defaults to False) to the ``@periodic_task`` decorator. If set to True, the task will be run in a separate green thread. Here and below I will call such task a *parallel task*. * Add ``thread_group`` argument to the ``run_periodic_tasks`` method of ``PeriodicTasks`` class with default value of None. If present, it should be a ``ThreadGroup`` on which to run parallel tasks. * Modify ``run_periodic_tasks`` so that parallel tasks are executed on a thread group, while the other executed as before. * Ensure that a parallel task is never run again while the previous run didn't finish. Add a new dictionary on ``Performance`` class to track this. Issue a warning if this situation happens. * Issue a warning, if a parallel task is encountered, but no ``thread_group`` is provided. Alternatives ------------ * ``thread_group`` parameter may go to the ``PeriodicTasks`` constructor. It would be a bit more code for Ironic, but otherwise looks just as well. * Finally, every project could just go into a thread for their tasks directly. Still, I think anyone using oslo.service could benifit from this feature. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- * Optional parameter ``parallel`` added to ``@periodic_task``. * Optional parameter ``thread_group`` added to ``run_periodic_tasks``. All changes are backward-compatible and default behavior is not changed. Security impact --------------- None expected. Performance Impact ------------------ No performance impact by default. For projects that opt-in into making some of their tasks parallel this change may greatly improve performance by separating long-running and short-running tasks and allowing the latter to run without being blocked by the former. Configuration Impact -------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- As a developer you may add ``parallel=True`` to your task to make it run on a thread group. Testing Impact -------------- Unit tests will be provide on the Oslo side. Each project using this feature may conduct it's own testing justifying it's usage. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: LP: divius, IRC: dtantsur Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Work Items ---------- * Add ``parallel`` parameter to ``@periodic_task``. * Implement support for parallel tasks in ``PeriodicTasks``. Documentation Impact ==================== Only docstrings update. Dependencies ============ None References ========== [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/133976/ - prototype .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
IBP: include cloud-init logs into diagnostic snapshot

cloud-init logs aren't included into snapshot.
This change will allow shotgun to grab them from remote nodes via ssh.

However, if cloud-init failed to init a node or to perform initial networking
setup, then manual investigation will be required.
Anyway, it's better to have the logs if it's possible to grab them.

Change-Id: Ie85f4c4748f337ec1acf92748b644a2a10266f65
Closes-Bug: #1468732

commit_message:
Add missing Pacemaker constraint against Keystone

The Heat contraints group was missing the initial
dependency on Keystone, causing Pacemaker to Heat before or
in parallel to Keystone.

Given Systemd can define dependencies in the unit files, this was
additionally causing an unmanaged start of Keystone making
cluster initialization to fail (with Keystone start timeout blocking
all the depending resources).

Also moves Keystone -> Ceilomter constraint on top of Ceilometer
constraints group for clarity.

Logs and more infos at [1]

1. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1235703

Change-Id: I9505fd46c5bf278afc8ff919c7e768e2de194cb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/195622/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pacemaker::constraint::base { 'keystone-then-ceilometer-central-constraint': constraint_type => 'order', first_resource => "${::keystone::params::service_name}-clone", second_resource => "${::ceilometer::params::agent_central_service_name}-clone", first_action => 'start', second_action => 'start', require => [Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::ceilometer::params::agent_central_service_name], Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::keystone::params::service_name]], } pacemaker::constraint::base { 'keystone-then-heat-api-constraint': constraint_type => 'order', first_resource => "${::keystone::params::service_name}-clone", second_resource => "${::heat::params::api_service_name}-clone", first_action => 'start', second_action => 'start', require => [Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::heat::params::api_service_name], Pacemaker::Resource::Service[$::keystone::params::service_name]], }

commit_message:
Add base for coordination as a mixin / tooz

Change-Id: I494b6a4144b9cec6e892a6a9e60ef5c3c21fec71
Depends-On: Ie474d02c3cb3b610d1fad64e88f863f37d9c01fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/09/193909/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Copyright 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log import tooz.coordination from designate.i18n import _LE LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('backend_url', default=None, help='The backend URL to use for distributed coordination. If ' 'left empty, per-deployment central agent and per-host ' 'compute agent won\'t do workload ' 'partitioning and will only function correctly if a ' 'single instance of that service is running.'), cfg.FloatOpt('heartbeat', default=1.0, help='Number of seconds between heartbeats for distributed ' 'coordination.'), cfg.FloatOpt('run_watchers', default=10.0, help='Number of seconds between checks to see if group ' 'membership has changed') ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(OPTS, group='coordination') CONF = cfg.CONF class CoordinationMixin(object): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(CoordinationMixin, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self._my_id = kwargs.get('my_id') or str(uuid.uuid4()) backend_url = cfg.CONF.coordination.backend_url self._coordinator = tooz.coordination.get_coordinator( backend_url, self._my_id) def start(self): super(CoordinationMixin, self).start() self._coordinator.start() self._coordinator.create_group(self.service_name) self._coordinator.join_group(self.service_name) # We add the timers on start vs init since the connection needs to come # up first. self.tg.add_timer(cfg.CONF.coordination.heartbeat, self._coordinator_heartbeat) self.tg.add_timer(cfg.CONF.coordination.run_watchers, self._coordinator_run_watchers) def stop(self): self._coordinator.leave_group(self._my_id) self._coordinator.stop() super(CoordinationMixin, self).stop() def _coordinator_heartbeat(self): try: self._coordinator.heartbeat() except tooz.coordination.ToozError: LOG.exception(_LE('Error sending a heartbeat to coordination ' 'backend.')) def _coordinator_run_watchers(self): self._coordinator.run_watchers()

commit_message:
Avoid installing duplicate flows

Currently the DB sync process is running in a loop
and updaing the L2 APP of new ports constantly.
This patch block re-configuration of flows to the vswitch
and install new flows if connection to controller is lost
and re-established

Change-Id: Icf1bee86ae7c6c29bf6870c772d06e4435a9e6c3

a separated file to track changes. This patch add an example for
this file (with sections and dates, formatted according to ISO-8601)

commit_message:
Extend glance-manage with version command

Provide new command category to glance-manage to be able to retrieve
version of currently installed Glance service. Usage:

$ glance-manage version show
2015.2.0

Change-Id: I5d0d1f91032c61af79869ab6cfb2d82eff05314c
Closes-Bug: 1456192
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/56/184056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance import versionclass VersionCommands(object): """Class for exposing the codebase version.""" def __init__(self): pass def show(self): print(version.version_string()) def add_command_parsers(subparsers): for category in CATEGORIES: command_object = CATEGORIES[category]() parser = subparsers.add_parser(category) parser.set_defaults(command_object=command_object) category_subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(dest='action') for (action, action_fn) in methods_of(command_object): parser = category_subparsers.add_parser(action) action_kwargs = [] for args, kwargs in getattr(action_fn, 'args', []): # FIXME(basha): hack to assume dest is the arg name without # the leading hyphens if no dest is supplied kwargs.setdefault('dest', args[0][2:]) if kwargs['dest'].startswith('action_kwarg_'): action_kwargs.append( kwargs['dest'][len('action_kwarg_'):]) else: action_kwargs.append(kwargs['dest']) kwargs['dest'] = 'action_kwarg_' + kwargs['dest'] parser.add_argument(*args, **kwargs) parser.set_defaults(action_fn=action_fn) parser.set_defaults(action_kwargs=action_kwargs) parser.add_argument('action_args', nargs='*') db_command_object = DbCommands() add_legacy_command_parsers(db_command_object, subparsers) 'version': VersionCommands,
deleted_lines: def add_command_parsers(subparsers): command_object = DbCommands() parser = subparsers.add_parser('db') parser.set_defaults(command_object=command_object) category_subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(dest='action') for (action, action_fn) in methods_of(command_object): parser = category_subparsers.add_parser(action) action_kwargs = [] for args, kwargs in getattr(action_fn, 'args', []): # FIXME(basha): hack to assume dest is the arg name without # the leading hyphens if no dest is supplied kwargs.setdefault('dest', args[0][2:]) if kwargs['dest'].startswith('action_kwarg_'): action_kwargs.append( kwargs['dest'][len('action_kwarg_'):]) else: action_kwargs.append(kwargs['dest']) kwargs['dest'] = 'action_kwarg_' + kwargs['dest'] parser.add_argument(*args, **kwargs) parser.set_defaults(action_fn=action_fn) parser.set_defaults(action_kwargs=action_kwargs) parser.add_argument('action_args', nargs='*') add_legacy_command_parsers(command_object, subparsers)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 18:34:38.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c5b62f5ea3bbd29717af55ac719a3ed069caea44', 'message': 'Remove the hardcoded concurrency limit for ostestr

ostestr by default uses concurrency = ncpu.

This caused all sorts of things to blow up in Cinder
when one got over 6 cpus.  Since the initial merge a
patch has landed that appears to fix the issues, and
we now run reliably at 8 and even 12 cpus.

commit_message:
Remove the hardcoded concurrency limit for ostestr

ostestr by default uses concurrency = ncpu.

This caused all sorts of things to blow up in Cinder
when one got over 6 cpus.  Since the initial merge a
patch has landed that appears to fix the issues, and
we now run reliably at 8 and even 12 cpus.

This patch removes the hard coded concurrency=6 setting
from tox.ini

Change-Id: I483e53acaf1bb71deeba20d6c81184112cbcb046
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/193676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # By default ostestr will set concurrency # to ncpu, to specify something else use # the concurrency=<n> option.commands = ostestr {posargs}
deleted_lines: # Note, we set concurrency to 6 here as a default # ostestr will take the last entry for occurence # so if you want to increase/decrease this you # can simply add concurrency arg to your toxcommands = ostestr --concurrency=6 {posargs}

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-26 13:14:00.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/test_bin.py', 'ceilometer/api/app.py', 'ceilometer/api/hooks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/6ea8dd113a3fe1f19b792a9012c17a3386893361', 'message': 'Handle database failures on api startup

Storage layer connections are initialized
for metering, alarm and event in Pecan hook
middleware.
If any of the backends are not responding,
the connections are retried till maximum
retries and the exception propagated to the
Ceilometer-api which fails to startup.

This fix logs and handles the exception in
the Pecan hook and allows all connection

Closes-Bug: 1456944

Change-Id: Id70693dafc823927b3d72e0371e3e55d4e5588ce
(cherry picked from commit 1f30839494c5b5002173a1f81eb960d735f39643)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle database failures on api startup

Storage layer connections are initialized
for metering, alarm and event in Pecan hook
middleware.
If any of the backends are not responding,
the connections are retried till maximum
retries and the exception propagated to the
Ceilometer-api which fails to startup.

This fix logs and handles the exception in
the Pecan hook and allows all connection
types to be initialized.

Closes-Bug: 1456944

Change-Id: Id70693dafc823927b3d72e0371e3e55d4e5588ce
(cherry picked from commit 1f30839494c5b5002173a1f81eb960d735f39643)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/45/196045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ceilometer.i18n import _LE from ceilometer.openstack.common import logfrom ceilometer import storage LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) def __init__(self): self.storage_connection = DBHook.get_connection('metering') self.event_storage_connection = DBHook.get_connection('event') self.alarm_storage_connection = DBHook.get_connection('alarm') if (not self.storage_connection and not self.event_storage_connection and not self.alarm_storage_connection): raise Exception("Api failed to start. Failed to connect to " "databases, purpose: %s" % ', '.join(['metering', 'event', 'alarm'])) @staticmethod def get_connection(purpose): try: return storage.get_connection_from_config(cfg.CONF, purpose) except Exception as err: params = {"purpose": purpose, "err": err} LOG.exception(_LE("Failed to connect to db, purpose %(purpose)s " "retry later: %(err)s") % params)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, conn, event_conn, alarm_conn): self.storage_connection = conn self.event_storage_connection = event_conn self.alarm_storage_connection = alarm_conn

commit_message:
Check if nailgun's requirements do not conflict

Added simple test that will try to parse nailgun's
requirements and see if there are any problems with them.

Change-Id: I342eda0a3b019780e0d452455734591aab91f6e9
Closes-Bug: #1462281

commit_message:
Ensure flush-net-cache on local host

In a multiple host deployment, the deploying host (which runs the playbooks)
may not be the host for the containers being destroyed. Therefore,
flush-net-cache is not performed on the deploying host.

This would cause connectivity problem between the deploying host and the
containers before the staled net cache timed out ultimately.

Therefore, the local host shall always perform flush-net-cache when a container
is destroyed.

Change-Id: Iac0afa58084d35d285067c404de85e3466ba62e9
Closes-Bug: #1469285

commit_message:
Upgrade to ansible 1.9.2

Update Ansible version to v1.9.2-1. This update includes a fix to
address CVE-2015-3908 - A vulnerability where HTTPS can be MITM'd.

Change-Id: I4dca72706cf73cdd974788e9c012ad8ecb7a9c15
Closes-Bug: #1466216
(cherry picked from commit c22296272e4e299db7c12f5f9b4608737da13729)

commit_message:
Fix inconsistency of message and validation when create env(dashboard)

If you create env with an invalid env name, the error message you get
conflicts with the rule of validating env name, change the rule to
adjust to the display message. Two validation rules need to be changed,
one at murano api, the other at muranodashboard.

Change-Id: Ib5a8a87cf295586214bced08c99a9e89ae1ee38f
Closes-bug: #1463852
Depends-On: I285709bf63ac8106343dfcc9898066a0ed060cb6

commit_message:
Fix inconsistency of error message and validation when create env

If you create env with an invalid env name, the error message you get
conflicts with the rule of validating env name, change the rule to
adjust to the display message. Two validation rules need to be changed,
one at murano api, the other at muranodashboard.

Change-Id: I285709bf63ac8106343dfcc9898066a0ed060cb6
Closes-bug: #1463852

commit_message:
Allow multiple lists for list_join intrinsic functions

Allow the HOT list_join function to optionally accept multiple
lists.  This is useful when you want to combine two or more lists,
for example to join a hard-coded list with a user provided one.

Although this is 100% backwards compatible, it's been added as a new
function which is available only via the Liberty HOT version.  This
should allow easier determination of whether a particular heat service
supports this revised syntax.

Change-Id: I375450960c6d486998308ec0b915c25628f745a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/28/195628/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hot_liberty_tpl_empty = template_format.parse(''' heat_template_version: 2015-10-15 ''') def test_list_join(self): snippet = {'list_join': [',', ['bar', 'baz']]} snippet_resolved = 'bar,baz' tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) self.assertEqual(snippet_resolved, self.resolve(snippet, tmpl)) def test_join_multiple(self): snippet = {'list_join': [',', ['bar', 'baz'], ['bar2', 'baz2']]} snippet_resolved = 'bar,baz,bar2,baz2' tmpl = template.Template(hot_liberty_tpl_empty) self.assertEqual(snippet_resolved, self.resolve(snippet, tmpl)) def test_join_invalid(self): snippet = {'list_join': 'bad'} tmpl = template.Template(hot_liberty_tpl_empty) exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Incorrect arguments', six.text_type(exc)) def test_join_invalid_value(self): snippet = {'list_join': [',']} tmpl = template.Template(hot_liberty_tpl_empty) exc = self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Incorrect arguments', six.text_type(exc)) def test_join_invalid_multiple(self): snippet = {'list_join': [',', 'bad', ['foo']]} tmpl = template.Template(hot_liberty_tpl_empty) exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Incorrect arguments', six.text_type(exc))

commit_message:
Added 'enabled' option in create user form

In create user form, no way to set the user is disabled.
by default it is setting the user as enabled.

This patch adding the Boolean field to set enable and disable the user
at the time creating.
